Reviews.Title: “Better beds..”
Reviews.Author: peter b
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 3 nights in April. We found the hotel staff very friendly, and vert helpfull. There English was very good. The hotel rooms were very modern. Good size bathroom and shower. The breakfast was very decent, very good hotel and would reccomend this to anyone who wants to be in the heart of Barcelona. 5 Minute walk to the beach - 10 Minute walk to the marina, 15 Minutes to La Rambla's. Very good location and very nice hotel but only down side would be that the walls are very thin and beds were not as comfy as i had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “moore piquante than picante”
Reviews.Author: laurentsw1
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 years living in Barcelona, i return there a few times a month for business and pleasure, an unlikely choice for me but i made the decision to stay at 54 because it sung a sweet song. staff at the hotel are lovely, having stayed at most of the hotels in Barcelona i can tell you that's not something you will say very often because as famous as Barcelona is for the architecture, sexy living and fabulous food its as famous for the brash demeanour of the people and the catastrophically terrible service it delivers to visitors. From the charming young lady who supervises breakfast to the cool young dude at the reception desk the service in this hotel I cannot fault. Staying honest with my review, the first night I was kept awake by the people on the other side of the interconnection door of my room. I was just happy that they were not having sex otherwise i would have freaked out!!! Woken up by the same lousy roomys early the next morning I rang down to reception to convey my horror and was offered a room change immediately. Nice, but nothing ticks a paying guest off more than up at night and up in the morning!!! Party season in ibiza I am prepared for but this was ridiculous. The thing that really ruined my stay at this hotel was the bites I received on my arm and on my face whilst staying in room 401 (fabulous view of the marina, room needs to be thoroughly cleaned). found myself taking a holiday snap I had not bargained on (attached). Breakfast reminded me that I travel way too much as the disappointment showed on my face when i saw the ridiculous presentation of a diy version of a continental breakfast! the first thing that went through my head is why the hell i had not stayed at the hotel Axel like i had planned! Gotta say, fabulous roof terrace which is a genuine suntrap. To be honest, wont be going back, nice views, not a terrible hotel but not a wonderful one. Not sure if this will get printed, but if eurotrash is your thing then this place is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: KTA2207
Reviews.Content: I spend here 1 week, coming for the Mobile World Congress, so i stayed here in February, and it was absolutely terrible. i travel a lot, so i've seen a big number of hotels, but honestly i wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. first, the hotel smelled like water drainage, sewer. i initially made a reservation for a single room, but 2 days before my arrival i called the reception to ask them to give me a double room, and they confirmed. they gave me room 101, first floor, the smallest room ever. i went to the same floor to check if they had any other free room, as the cleaning lady was on the floor and 3 rooms were opened. one of the rooms was free. went down to the reception to ask them nicely if they can change my room because of the space and they've told me they were fully booked. i told them that i saw that other free room, bigger of course and available, the receptionist went behind a curtain to talk with her manager i presume, and she accepted my request, obviously being bothered by it. in the evening, when we returned, we discovered that the sheets were dirty, filled with red stains(!!!). called the receptionist again(it was about 11pm), and asked for the sheets to be changed. they brought us 3 WET sheets. called again and got an answer that it is too late and they don't have anything else. of course, the heat in the room, although on the control panel showed 28 degrees it was only about 20. called again the reception and was told that they can't do anything about it, and this is because we have a BIG room. tiles on the floor, not even one tiny carpet, no heating in the bathroom. the bathroom was made out of 2 glass walls, so that, if you are 2 in the same room and one of you is using the toilet or the shower, or even using the water or doing whatever, the other can hear and partially see the one in the bathroom. the second day we managed to get another 3 blankets, but during the third night, we saw that we only had 2 blankets. called the reception again and were told that the hotel is fully booked and they can't allow me to have 3 blankets!!!!!! and that if I'm not satisfied with the answer i should speak with the manager in the morning!!! the breakfast was ok, and the only good thing about this hotel was the location, very close to the beach, about 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro station- Barceloneta, and also about 15 minutes walk from La Rambla. awful hotel, no heating, tiles on the floor, very cold and smells like sewer drainage, dirty sheets and dirty towels- worst hotel ever, not even 1 star!!!

Reviews.Title: “You will hear everything that your neighbours do.”
Reviews.Author: aardvark k
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other comments on here about style over substance. But the location is pretty good, and if you can get a deal on a room, it might be perfectly serviceable for you. That is, if you don't mind hearing everything your neighbours do. There's no soundproofing or insulation in the walls, so if you're a light sleeper, this will be a problem. The wifi is not free, it's a pay per use service.

Reviews.Title: “still want more?”
Reviews.Author: LokiA
Reviews.Content: we spent three nights at this hotel. and generally i can tell that this is not the worst three star hotel. first - the staff is really friendly, second - the location is perfect, third (and the last) quite reasonable price. Of course, the selection for breakfast is poor(((( together with quality of food. The walls in the rooms are sooooooo thin, that you can hear every breath someone's taking over the wall - and i'm not talking about sex (it is impossible since whole floor can hear the sound of every movement))))))))))))))))))).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mexexpat
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at this hotel in mid-November. Because I was here during the off-season, the hotel was very quiet, there was plenty of room at breakfast time, checking in and out was a breeze and the rate was very reasonable (under 70 euros). My room was small but efficient, clean and tastefully done. The bathroom may not have been large but I never felt cramped. As far as noise, I did not hear my neighbors (maybe I had none?). I could hear some street noise although this was not very loud (of course, the sidewalks were not very crowded). My room did not have a mini-bar but that was not a big deal for me since I can never get myself to pay for the inflated prices (even when a client is paying for my expenses). There are plenty of stores nearby where you can purchase water, drinks and any snacks you might need. I liked that the room came with a safe large enough to fit my laptop. If you have a 15” laptop, you should have no problems storing it in there. The staff was very friendly and always ready to help. The lady working the breakfast area was especially chatty, friendly and fun to visit with. There was a couple with a young child having breakfast when I was there and she made sure the child ate well and even sent them off with water and snacks for their day of sightseeing. (By the way, there was plenty to choose from for breakfast.) The location is excellent with easy access to the beach, marina and a 5-minute walk to MB92 (for those of us that are here for work). Las Ramblas is an easy walk and Plaza Catalunya is not too far, either (I chose to walk to Plaza Catalunya instead of taking the bus or metro). Bus and subway access are nearby and they will get you to just about anywhere in the city and even to the airport (taxi ride from the airport to the hotel was about 25 euros). What I did not like: - Wi-Fi is available for free in the rooms but it was having problems while I was there. - I would have gladly given up the colored accent lights in the bedroom for better lighting in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “More apartment than hotel”
Reviews.Author: kattuk99
Reviews.Content: Great location, slick modern look, but a little but style over substance at times. Shower head didnt work properly, and room was quite noisy. I could certainly deal with all that, neither were deal breakers for me - its just when you pay for a hotel there are things you expect, especially when there are so many great hostels in Barcelona. Next time I'll probably just opt for one of those instead. Its a nice hotel, and I am not saying you shouldnt go, I'd just warn you, its more Ikea than Heals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saffer102
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel just after 11 am in the pouring rain. The gentleman on reception was very accommodating and we got to our rooms within 20 min (considering that check in was only after 1). The room was neat and the bathroom too. We quickly changed clothes and went down to reception where the receptionist helped us with some travel tips (as it was raining and the end of Merce Festival) After a long day of sightseeing - got back to the hotel and had a hot shower. The lady on receiption was very helpful when it came to the aircon and explaining about the wifi and offered to come up to our rooms if we were unable to come right. Over the road from the hotel was an enormous fun fair (which was very noisy - but festive). Went on to the roof terrace and watched the fireworks. Yes the walls are thin but after a long day of activity and sigh seeing ( we fell asleep rather quickly) As check out was only at 12 we were able to soak up some sun on the Barceloneta Beach before heading off to the port to meet our cruise ship. The hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing and to enjoy the beaches

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: nides77
Reviews.Content: A small hotel placed on the harbour leading towards Barceloneta beach. We were able to go to the beach everyday after a hard day of sight seeing.....Perfect. Rooms: Average sized, funky modern bedrooms. Excellent showers and air conditioning. Baby cot available on request. No fridge in our room, but available in other rooms. Noise is an issue if your room is on the main road (but we were able to sleep through this) Roof terrace: Brilliant place to have drinks (Spa down the road for reasonably priced drinks). Ice cream next door. Staff: Friendly and helpful. Had a problem with the shower; immediately upgraded and given a bunch of flowers. Breakfast: Enjoyable. illy coffee (best we have had). Fresh spanish omlette and puree tomato sauce. Selection cereals and pastries. Overall a well priced hotel for the location, rooms and breakfast. Lost a point for lack of fridge and minor noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but paper-thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Just a few blocks from the beach, close to museums, restaurants, convenience stores and ice cream parlors. The look of the hotel is fun and contemporary. The hotel is right on the harbor. Our room was very small, but it had everything we needed as we were only really looking for a place to sleep (who wants to hang out in a hotel when you're in Barcelona?). But, since we were only looking for a place to sleep, this was a poor choice. The walls were so thin that we could literally hear our next door neighbor breathing. We could hear his feet shuffle across the floor, and we heard a lovely conversation he had with his wife and kids via skype. If you just want a place to store your belongings while you party the night away in Barcelona, this could be a good match. However, if you want a good night's sleep while your on vacation, don't stay here. I'm only giving it a poor rating because I just wanted a good night's sleep, and I was so disappointed that I didn't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, fab breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: needsmoreholidays23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my mum for a relaxing beach break and this hotel was great. Hotel is so close to the beach and a short walk to las ramblas etc. Lovely restaurants and bars close by and the best icecream shop next door! Roof terrace offered great views of the harbour and it was great to sit at the end of the day with a cold beer up there. As many people have said the breakfasts are great! Lots of choice and plenty for those coming down a bit late. Reception staff are really friendly and helpful and the housekeeping staff always offered a friendly smile. Rooms were really clean and towels changed daily if you wanted. Lovely hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jan f
Reviews.Content: We loved the Barceloneta neighborhood & the proximity to the beaches. the rooms are very contemporary & we had a window that opened on the main street. People walked up and down enjoying the great weather and the late sunsets - after 9pm. It was raucous, but the noise blended in all together. Staff was helpful & knowledgeable about the neighborhood and sights in Barcelona. Lots of great dining choices and the ice cream next door is a nice treat after being out.

Reviews.Title: “Its All About Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: iamjimmorrison
Reviews.Content: from reddgranite.com Forwarding our desire to arm travelers with the best information possible, I thought I would quickly review the hotel that I bunked down for 6 days in Barcelona, Spain. This is in the neighborhood of Barceloneta, quite near the main beach of Barcelona. In fact, for this property, it is all about location, location, location. For you Americans out there, this property is actually a franchise of the Best Western chain, although you would never know it by the property. Located about 300 meters from the beach, it has a perfect location on Passieg de Joan de Borbo, the main artery of Barceloneta leading to the beach. It is nestled among many shops and cafes. The property has been updated to a modest, but somewhat sleek contemporary design. A design that separates it from the many older looking buildings (mostly apartments) that surround it. There are just 28 rooms in this hotel. The rooms are Euro-small with little amenities. I had a basic room looking over Joan de Borbo, which many of their rooms do. Decorated in grey and a sort of off shaded blue, these rooms are a bit dark in the inside as is the halls leading to the rooms. However, the bed is comfortable, and the bathroom facilities, although once again, small, are very pleasant. Each room contains a flat screen TV of about 23″ for those of you who cannot bag your jet lag. The staff is guarded but helpful. Now of course, Americans are not the most popular anywhere you travel these days, and you feel it here as well. It took several days for me to figure which of the staff at the front desk were the most helpful and out going. 3 to 4 days into it, three such staff warmed up and became most helpful in suggestions for dining, hanging, and assistance for tours. English is spoken fairly well at this hotel: a comfort for those Americans and many English speaking Euro countries who visit here. Breakfast is included with the room for most pricing plans. The breakfast is modest with cereals, yogurts, prepackaged croissants. There was also the obligatory breakfast meets and cheeses popular in Europe. All was self serve with the exception of the coffee, which the single person manning the breakfast served directly upon request. Again, the serve was divided here, one person on several of the days did not speak a word and it was difficult to get her attention to get another coffee….and the remaining two days, it was manned by a person beaming with personality and a desire to assure you had enough coffee and breakfast. The breakfast area is small. Overflow people eat in the lobby chairs. Now the star of this hotel is the roof top access, pictured to the left. This is a stunning view of Port Vell and Barcelona city as well. Very little used, this is a great place to take a bottle of wine up to relax and let the city slowly drift to sleep, under the ever presence of Monsarret in the top of the mountain in the distance. There is a bar area in the lobby for which you can get a drink if you can get the front desk to mix it (the bar does not have a bar tender), or if you bring your own wine, they will be happy to give you a glass and a cork screw to work your own magic. Out of the six nights at this property, I spent three of them up here with my wine after sampling the fare of the cafes in the city below. This place is not inexpensive. I was at the beginning of the prime tourist season, and my room averaged 140E per night. They were completely booked the entire time. A quick check of their website HOTEL 54 yields similar rates. Again, this is all about location. One of the criticisms is that the rooms tend to be a bit noisy as they face the main street. I did not find this too annoying. There was some noise, but nothing that could not be dealt with. If this is an issue for you, request a non-street facing room. Do provide some calorie budget for the close by options to Hotel 54. Not only is it in the center of Barceloneta with its many great cafes serving fresh seafood with more eyes staring back at you than you care to count, or great dishes of traditional paella, there is a gelato/ice cream shop beneath Hotel 54. Yes, I was here every night and loved it. Overall, I highly recommend Hotel 54. This high recommendation does come with caveats. First, you must want to be a beach rat. This is all about its proximity to Barceloneta beach, the ports, the shopping mall in Port Vell, and the cafes. Second, do be aware of the petty robberies. Barceloneta, with its high population of back packers (read young people without a job) is worse than usual for thieves. And these thieves prey on the hotels where they know tourists will be more venerable. Be aware. I was not completely, and did get a back pack stolen in front of the hotel…….my bad, I guess, was not careful enough. So this is a word to you who may take this recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for the money, brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Awhulluk
Reviews.Content: I sometimes wonder when reading other reviews what some people expect from a 3* hotel at the prices that you pay. We found this hotel more than adequate, rooms were clean and very comfortable, reception staff were friendly and very helpful recommending good sights to see. The location was superb and the views were lovely. Breakfast was traditional continental, ok not great but certainly not bad by any means. We found some great bars off the main streets nearby which didn't charge the usual high Barcelona prices, great time all round. For those that want luxury don't book a 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor dirty accomodation poor staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: andi4ka
Reviews.Content: We were charged £200 Euros a night for a dirty average room, that had not had the bed sheets changed, or the bathroom cleaned. The previous visitors hair was in the bed, and the bathroom was to say the least in a deplorable dirty state, the cleaner must have been off that day!!!. The receptionist in the morning appeared fine, and said our room was not ready, so we visited Barcelona for the day, returned at 6pm. I had already left my credit card details and the second receptionist could not find my booking although they had our luggage behind the desk???. We complained about the cleaniness of the room, and was assurred it would be cleaned, it was, but poorly. They left a bottle of Cava, and strawberries, so were aware of the issues. When checking out they tried to say we had used the phone in the room, when challenged to produce evidence they stated it was a mistake and omitted off the bill, strange would you not say!!. Breakfast attendant very ignorant which was sad to see. I am a structural chartered surveyor and the refurbishment of the property has been poorly undertaken in my considered opinion, it has been undertaken on a shoestring, and the decor is getting tired. The walls are paper thin, no insulation or sound proofing, so be aware you will hear all and sundry from other rooms. The guests in the next room to us were quite loud to say the least. Would not recommend for children. Great location, great view of the marina, beach 100 yards away, albiet the hotel staff let the hotel down, great shame.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect no frills hotel for single traveller, great location & price”
Reviews.Author: UkPrincess13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after a business trip at the Hilton Diagonal Mar Hotel which I believed was far too expensive and too far out from the main town. I chose this Hotel 54 Barceloneta due to the reviews on here and I wasn't disappointed. I was travelling alone so I wanted a cheap hotel close to the centre and this ticked all the boxes. Location: 5 minutes walk to the beach and there's restaurants, supermarkets and a pharmacy on the same street. Lots of restaurants close by. The Port Olympic area is only a 20 minute walk and the Aquarium a 10 minute walk. Las Ramblas is around a 20-25 minute walk. Hotel room: Modern and quite basic (I had a single room) and the rooms were very clean but there's no bath only a shower facility but a very good shower! The rooms are quire small for single rooms. The major complaint I had was that the rooms were not soundproof so if you have a room at the front of the hotel be aware as it can get quite noisy. There are no major clubs or anything nearby so there's no noise really late at night, except for you hear the other guests getting back to their rooms. My main issue with the rooms was the soundproofing, I would take ear plugs if I stayed here again. Breakfast: Contiental buffet breakfast which is nice. There is no cooked breakfast on offer but lots of croissants, cakes, yoghurts, cereal etc, which I thought was more then enough choice including meat/cheese/bread rolls. I would rather they had pots of coffee out instead of you having to ask the 1 very busy waiter each time for another coffee. There was only 1 member of staff on at breakfast and he was very busy and not very friendly (but hey, I had been used to the breakfast at the Hilton on the previous days! so I must not complain). I recommend you take a kettle for the room though as there's no tea/coffee facilities available and none provided. Breakfast area is very small so goodness knows what it's like when the hotel is very busy. Reception staff are nice and friendly and there's a small seating area downstairs with free WIFI. There's also free WIFI in the hotel rooms (passwords given in the hotel guide) which was a really fast service. Overall, if you are happy with a cheap, budget no frills hotel that's close to the beach and not too far from the town centre with a Pharmacy, good restaurants, and 2 supermarkets very close by then this would be a great choice. As a single traveller I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: crazylab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to find from the street. No parking around. On a very busy street. Very noisy. The hotel itself is noisy inside too. Floors are noisy. Thin walls you hear EVERYTHING. Beds are lumpy,springy and hard.The corridors are painted in a very gloomy dark grey (feels like an army barrack) no light. No breakfast. No international TV channels. Parking is a big 20 euros. Even if they tell you it's only 300 meters away (really 600m.) by the time you follow all the one way streets in heavy traffic, it's far ! This hotel is highly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 days post cruise and selected this hotel because of it's small size and location to the beach. The location did not not disapoint. The room was small but had a good size bthrm and a small balcony giving the room a charming touch. The view from the balcony was incredible as you could see the port, the hub of BCN and the street with it's outside restaurants below. A trip to the rooftop gave a 360 view, absolutely stunning but unfortunate that the rooftop bar was never open. Staff seemed to be somewhat reserved leaving you to take the initiative if you wanted assistance. I can't really comment on the cleanliness of the room or public areas as the lighting was so dim I would only be guessing. Once the sun went down it was not possible to read a book with the dim lights. Breakfast was more on the continental side rather than the full american breakfast they advertise but still ok. All in all it does have it's own charm and is quaint compared to some of the large commercial hotel. An experience worth having

Reviews.Title: “fab wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanmoore1981
Reviews.Content: could not be in a better position !!! really friendly staff and fantastic views of the city from most rooms and the fantastic roof top terrace thats always unoccupied so kinda feels like your own private terrace!!! only let down was the bed wasnt really that comfortable, but not a huge issue!! breakfast was included and was really nice, again staff very friendly and helpfull as always!!! cant wait to go back !!! NB DO NOT EAT AT THE SEAFOOD RESTAURANTS JUST OUTSIDE THE HOTEL AS THE FOOD IS AWFUL AND OVERPRICED!!

Reviews.Title: “a little jewel in Barceloneta”
Reviews.Author: kaiopenedes
Reviews.Content: this hotel probably fits a 3 star quality, oficially, however, it could easily be more than that. small, trendy , good location, clean and practical. The Reception desk is very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerScotland
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel, situated just a few minutes from the beach. Fantastic roof terrace. Room was very small, with very little storage space (1 small single wardrobe), although had a fair size bathroom. Walls were very thin making it easy to hear conversation from next door! Would recommend, but for no more than a 2 night stay as limited space would have become irritating.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: pinkspectacles
Reviews.Content: We have Best Western Hotels all over the world and sadly this has to be the worst ever. The hotel room faced the port. Having just arrived from a long flight we needed some rest, At 6 pm the fairground across the street started and the room was literally shaking. The staff moved us to another box of a room, at the back of the hotel where by midnight we fell asleep in our very hard bed. We had accepted a room with a broken sink for the promise of a quiet night's sleep. The following evening, yes we could hear the fair but at eleven o'clock a band started in the street, the place was shaking until past two in the morning. The maids were in the corriddor at 8 in the morning. We were quite simply shattered. We complained to the staff who were unable to do anything, they too they said were tired!! Not up to Best Westerns normal three star standard. If you need more than 6 hours sleep don't stay there. Horrid little place with very poor partial double glazing and an inadequate continental breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: Swellyeah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked by clients I was visiting, so I had no idea what it would be like. On arrival it all seemed ok, just a small hotel that has made efforts to make itself look as modern as possible in order to disguise its shortcomings. The location is great. However once you see past the "modern" stylings, the facade rather falls away. You can't polish a t*rd as they say, and this remains a rather pokey little place. The rooms are small and of weird layout. The floor is all tiled, so careful you don't go AoverT when you come out of the bathroom! Breakfast was nothing special - but the coffee was hot and the bread fresh - so no complaints there. The "bar" is real let down. I asked for a "drinks list" and was virtually laughed at...so always remembering he who laughs last, laughs longest - I simply went to spend my hard earned elsewhere. The maid service however provided something of a shock. One morning, the maid let some random woman into my room. Upon waking and telling her to get out - the maid and the mystery woman simply stood by the open door chatting despite my eager requests that they should shut the DOOR! Hmm, quite sure this isn't the way its meant to work! Would I stay there again? Only if I was sent there by someone else - there is no way I would actually book it myself...despite the great location.

Reviews.Title: “hotel 54”
Reviews.Author: cns259
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel, and it has recently been taken over by Best Western. It still retains the air of a small boutique hotel though, and isn't at all corporate. The reception area is very modern and cool looking, and includes an attractive bar. It seems to be under-used though. It couldn't be described as "lively"....not necessarily a bad thing. Reception were friendly and helpful, especially the girls. the two male members of staff were less forthcoming, but I think they might be less confident of their English language skills. Check in was simple, though we arrived at lunchtime and the room wasn't quite ready, which was fair enough. It was ready within 30 minutes. It's the sort of hotel that doesn't have staff all over you, taking your bags etc. You are pretty much left to get on with things yourself...again, no bad thing in my book. The corridors are dark, but they're not too bad, and it wasn't a significant problem for us. It's just modern chic....LED lighting, that kind of thing. The room itself was a twin at the front of the Hotel, though they had put the beds together, as requested. Very stark modern decor, but cool and funtional. Watch out for sharp corners (particularly on the modern french windows, they open inwards and it's easy to slice your foot with the corner if you are not careful and are wearing sandals). The window opens onto a small balcony with fab views over the port side of Barceloneta, and across to Montjuic. There's an LCD TV, with plenty of channels, but none English. If you want to watch TV here, you're in the wrong place anyway. The phone is Jacob Jensen, which should give you an idea where the hotel style is. There's a wet room and stylish wash area. As has been mentioned elsewhere, the lighting is LED with switchable mood colours. The room was clean and comfortable (though you have to be someone who likes a firm mattress). There's a small fridge/minibar, which is useful, and it's only stocked with basics. The only down side to the room.was that all the concrete seemed to transmit noise quite efficiently, so you could almost hear the neighbours brushing their teeth. However, it is not a noisy party hotel. The other guests all seemed to be either singles, or couples, and several of them same sex. In the original brochures, the hotel is described as Gay friendly, which it certainly seemed to be. It's not really a family hotel, though I understand the suite is a good family space. Breakfast was simple, and the coffee was great. It was included in our price. I wouldn't have wanted to pay more than 10 euros for it though. Now to the two absolute stand out features of the hotel. The first is the location. It is brilliant. A minute's walk to the beach and new promenade. The port in front of the hotel and all the restaurants along side. Very close to the port cable car. The Barceloneta market and the small cafe squares of the Barceloneta district are all on your doorstep. The Born district is about 10 minute's walk, the Barrio Gothic about 15 minutes and the Ramblas about 25 minutes. We walked everywhere with no problem. The second stand out feature is the roof terrace with a panoramic view over the city, from Sagrada Familale to Montjuic. We had it to ourselves for pretty much the entire weekend. Superb, and like the bar, seemingly under-used. All in all, I would have given this top marks, but have deducted points because I think it is expensive for what you get. However, this will maybe keep it quiet and exclusive. We will definitely go back. My rating 95%.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: emmaplews
Reviews.Content: this hotel was well located in the barcelonata area, near the beach and seafood restaurants but it seemed we were paying more for the "stlyised" interior than anything else. Our room was beyond small, we had one small wardrobe, one tiny bedside table and that was it. And just enough space to walk around the outside of the bed. The bathroom was again small, but it was nice, although everything seemed a little unfinished - tiling, paint work etc One of the biggest problems was the squeky bed. we couldnt even roll onto our side without the bed making an enormous creak. Not what you want on a weekend away with your boyfriend. anyway..i go on. It was ok...but for 165 Euros a night I wouldn't have expected all of the negative things above.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tempo_rubato
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in the hotel and overall our stay was very pleasant. Although there was a mistake about the room they had reserved for us, quickly we were upgraded to a seaview room. We found the staff very friendly. The hotel is conveniently located close to the beach and the port but also not too far from the metro station and the trendy area of Born where one can find a number of nice tapas bars and restaurants. Indeed we thought that 12e for breakfast is quite high especially when one can get a great breakfast at the nearby Buenas Migas (two blocks from the hotel, on the beach) at a fraction of that price.

Reviews.Title: “too pricy for the service not for the location”
Reviews.Author: Blondsea
Reviews.Content: Certainly the location is supperb. It is the only hotel on this side of Barceloneta. It is new, fancy and cool. BUT (and it is a big but) it is also too pricy for the service one gets: 18 euros for a breakfast of a bit more than a coffee and a toast. Besides we got a weird charge of 30 euros for "making use of the lobby" where we expend no more than half an hour reading a couple of days -never seen in all my trips around the world! Bizarre.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad booking experience”
Reviews.Author: Viajante84
Reviews.Content: Their booking service is a shame. Having reserved a room, the owner of the hotel emails me, because he says the price is an error, and tries to fool me, thinking I don’t know my rights when I booked, even thought I have the confirmation. He tries to make me pay, for their error. I ended up not staying at the hotel, because of the owner and the receptionist lack of professionalism, therefore I couldn't expect a good service.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: sue2sons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new. We did not like the decor. It was dark grey and was not appealing. The rooms were small but the location was good. The front desk was very helpful. Paloma was a delight and helped us with all our little problems. TV does not have English channels. It was walking distance from the Born and near some good places to eat. It was not noisy if you stayed in the rear. We found it to be in a safe area and enjoyed walking to the beach. We never used the roof deck. The price was good for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Londonist_Y
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a weekend at Hotel 54, and on every level I found it to be appalling. They had firstly made a mistake with our booking, and kept on telling me that I was in the wrong until I pointed out their mistake on their own booking form. There was no apology, and they became surly. The rooms look good, but everything has been done very cheaply - the beds are hard, the shower is weak and the flat-screen TV only has 5 channels. The cool roof terrace bar was supposed to open at 7pm, but by 8:30pm was still closed so we gave up. The air-con in our room was also faulty and the toilet broke, and despite all this the management made no attempt to correct these problems - either trying to tell me that I was wrong (I was even told that 26 degrees C setting on the air-con is supposed to be cold), or getting at best a shrug. The service in this hotel is truly awful and the rooms are all style with no substance. Barcelona is fantastic city, so don't spoil the fun by staying at Hotel 54.
